SX0031/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFMN/NICE/COTE EXPERIMENTATION OF 4 INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURES TO FACILITATE OPTIMIZED DESCENTS. VALIDITY: 18APR24 - 25DEC24 THIS AIP SUP CONCERNS THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT OF OPTIMIZED DESCENT PROFILES ON THE INITIAL APPROACHES (INA = INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURE) OF FLIGHTS INBOUND FOR NICE COTE D AZUR (LFMN). AN OPTIMIZED DESCENT MEANS A DESCENT WITH REDUCED FUEL CONSUMPTION AND NOISE POLLUTION (TO DESCEND CONTINUOUSLY, TO THE GREATEST POSSIBLE EXTENT, BY EMPLOYING MINIMUM ENGINE THRUST, IDEALLY IN A LOW DRAG CONFIGURATION, PRIOR TO THE FINAL APPROACH POINT). THROUGHOUT THE VALIDITY PERIOD OF THIS AIP SUP, AND WHEN CONDITIONS ALLOW (TRAFFIC, WEATHER, ETC.), THE CONTROLLER USES THE PROCEDURES PUBLISHED IN ORDER TO LIMIT RADAR VECTORING. THE CREWS, WITH THE INFORMATION OF THE DISTANCE REMAINING TO THE RUNWAY MUST PERFORM OPTIMIZED DESCENTS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT WILL TAKE PLACE AT ANY TIME (DAY OR NIGHT), DURING LIGHT TRAFFIC SITUATION, ONCE THE AIRCRAFT HAS BEEN TRANSFERRED TO NICE APP. IF THE TRAFFIC SITUATION DOES NOT ALLOW THE USE OF THE TRAJECTORIES,THE PILOT SHOULD EXPECT RADAR VECTORING TOWARDS THE INITIAL FIX OF THE PROCEDURE IN USE. RNAV(GNSS) PROCEDURES: RWY04R RAPOT1M/1N RWY04L LEMPU1M/1N RWY04L/R BISBO1M/1N RWY22L/R SOTOX1M/1N

DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

TWY P WILL BE CLSD BTN TWYS P4 AND N11 DRG THIS PERIOD. THE JUNCTIONS LEADING TO TWYS P4, P6, P8, P10 AND P14 TO THE E WILL BE MARKED AS CLSD BY MEANS OF RED STOP BAR LGT. AFT LDG ON RWY 07L/25R, ACCESS TO THE APN WILL EXCLUSIVELY BE VIA TWY P1. IN DEV FM THE SPECIFIED TIMES OF THE WINTER SER SEASON, IT WILL NO LONGER BE POSS TO USE DEICING PADS 1 AND 2 UNDER ANY WEATHER COND FM THE TIME THE EASTERN TWY BRIDGES ARE CLSD. - OPR DIRECTION 25: ALL TAX TFC (INBD) FM RWY 25R WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS P1, N-N, N15 AND ONWARDS VIA TWY L TO THE E. ALL TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) WILL BE CONDUCTED ACCORDING TO THE STD. - OPR DIRECTION 07: ALL TAX TFC (INBD) FM RWY 07L WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS P1, N-N, N15 AND ONWARDS VIA TWY N TO THE E. TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWY L ACCORDING TO THE STD. PILOTS WHO ARE UNA TO ACPT A TKOF RUN ON RWY 18 AFT GUIDANCE FM TWY L SHALL NOTIFY APN CTL IN GOOD TIME. IN THIS CASE, TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS L, Y AND N. THE TRANSFER OF TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 BTN APN CTL AND THE TWR IS CONDUCTED IN FRONT OF TWY L20. ALTERNATIVELY, ACFT CAN ALSO BE ROUTED VIA TWYS L, N15 AND N. ACFT TURNING E ONTO TWY N FM TWY N15 (COMING FM THE N) DO NOT CONFLICT WITH ACFT TURNING W ONTO TWY N FM TWY N15 (COMING FM THE S). - TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 07C WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWY L. ACFT UP TO ICAO CAT MEDIUM FOR WHICH AN INT TKOF IS REQ WITH APN CTL WILL BE TRANSFERRED TO THE TWR IN GOOD TIME. PILOTS SHOULD INFORM THE TWR AS EARLY AS WITH THE START-UP APPROVAL WHETHER THEY ACPT AN INT TKOF 07C. FOR OPR DIRECTION 07, SULU DEP MIGHT BE PROACTIVELY MOV FM RWY 07C TO RWY 18. - THE IMPORTANCE OF THE PUBLISHED HIRO PROC WHICH REQUIRES VACATING THE RWY AS QUICKLY AS POSS AFT LDG, BEING READY FOR TKOF AT THE RWY WHEN DEP, AND TAX OFF IMT UPON RECEIPT OF THE TKOF CLR. IN GEN, ALL ACFT OF CATEGORIES MEDIUM AND LGT DEP FM RWY 18 SHOULD ALSO PREPARE FOR A TKOF FM TWY M OR TWY S. CONTRARY TO AD 2.20 EDDF SECTION 5.3, ALL ACFT PARKED ON ACFT STANDS E OF TWY N4 SHALL EXP TO TAX TO RWY 18 VIA TWYS U, T, R AND S. THE EXACT CLSD HR AND CLSD AREAS OF THE TWY CONCERNED WILL BE ANNOUNCED VIA NOTAM

AX0002/20 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR THE PILOT OF THE AIRCRAFT OPERATING IN THE LIBYAN AIR SPACE A. THE LIBYAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY STRESSES THE PILOT OF AIRCRAFT OPERATING OUTSIDE THE FIELD OF HIGH COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE NECESSITY OF USING VHF/ RT RANGE .RADIO FREQUENCY ASSIGNED TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION BETWEEN PILOTS VHF AIR / AIR VOLINTARY REPORT. B. FOR MORE COORDINATION BETWEEN THE OPPOSING AIR TRAFFIC, ESPECIALLY THOSE OPERATING OUTSIDE THE CONTROLLED AIRSPACE, IN ORDER TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF AIR NAVIGATION IN THE LIBYAN AVIATION TERRITORY AND THE MENTIONED RADIO FREQUENCIES ARE: 1- WHEN FLYING AT OR BELOW THE FLYING LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 123.5 MHZ 2- WHEN FLYING ABOVE A FLIGHT LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 126.9 MHZ C. THIS AUTHORITY ALSO STRESSES THE NEED TO OBTAIN PRIOR PERMISSION FOR FLIGHTS BEFORE TAKING OFF FROM AIRPORTS THAT ARE NOT SUBJECT TO THE MAJOR AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL CENTERS IN TRIPOLI AND ITS BRANCH IN BENGHAZI BY WAY OF HIGH-FREQUENCY RADIO

SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
